medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 3 months before admission with periodic numbness of the lower lip. After childbirth 2.5 months prior, the patient experienced intermittent numbness in the pelvis and thighs while walking. Seven weeks before admission, unusual behavior episodes began, lasting about 30 minutes. Symptoms progressed to panic attacks, insomnia, and feelings of anxiety and hopelessness. Episodes of fatigue and diminished hearing occurred, alongside nonverbal behavior lasting several hours, followed by amnesia for these events. Darkening of vision and horizontal diplopia appeared 4 days before admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Postpartum depression and anxiety diagnosed; no known allergies; hemorrhoids with hematochezia during two pregnancies without complications.
medical_history.family_history: Father had renal cancer and prostate cancer; uncle had depression; otherwise, family members are healthy with no reported endocrine issues.
medical_history.social_history: Patient is a lactating mother, drank wine occasionally until symptoms began, did not smoke or use illicit drugs, and lives with her husband and children.
